sources.title: Tokyo File 212
sources.description: From IMDb; A Communist spy ring in Japan is hard at work trying to sabotage the American war effort during the Korean War, using kidnapping, murder and a disturbed former kamikaze pilot. A U.S. secret agent, posing as a reporter, is dispatched to Tokyo to put a stop to these nefarious activities. Also see http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0044133/ Executive Producer was Melvin Belli. (THE Melvin Belli)

sources.title: Tokyo File 212 (1951) SPY THRILLER
sources.description:
Exclusive FRIDAY @ PizzaFLIX edition
Stars: Florence Marly, Lee Frederick, Katsuhiko Haida 
Directors: Dorrell McGowan, Stuart E. McGowan

A film by George Breakston, set during the Korean War. Posing as a journalist, a US secret agent is dispatched to Tokyo to renew his friendship with a former college roommate, who now is suspected to be the head of a communist spy ring. The first American film shot entirely on location in Japan.

metadata.Plot: A Communist spy ring in Japan is hard at work trying to sabotage the American war effort during the Korean War, using kidnapping, murder and a disturbed former kamikaze pilot. A U.S. secret agent, posing as a reporter, is dispatched to Tokyo to put a stop to these nefarious activities.
metadata.Writer: George P. Breakston, Dorrell McGowan, Stuart E. McGowan
metadata.Actors: Florence Marly, Lee Frederick, Katsuhiko Haida
